intro: Solanum vescum, commonly known as the bitter nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy. Its small, yellowish flowers give way to berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
